summary: The diff implements a playable 2D obstacle-avoidance game with keyboard controls, scoring, and backend high score persistence. It includes a cohesive visual theme with custom color palette and typography. However, the backend implementation has significant issues (incorrect Motoko syntax, non-functional logic), and the required generated image assets are not present in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: Render generated game assets including background images, character sprites, or game element graphics as static assets in frontend/public/assets/generated
missing_requirements.reason: The diff references image paths in frontend/public/assets/generated (game-background.dim_1920x1080.png, player-sprite.dim_128x128.png, game-element.dim_96x96.png) in gameAssets.ts, but no files were added to this directory in the diff. The images are not included.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend Motoko implementation using incorrect syntax and non-functional data structures
hallucinated_features.reason: The backend/main.mo file uses invalid Motoko syntax (e.g., List.empty, List.add, List.filter methods) and patterns that do not match the mo:core library API. The BuildRequest specified single-actor Motoko backend, but the implementation would not compile or function. This represents hallucinated/broken functionality not requested in the spec.

hallucinated_features.description: Non-functional play() backend method that always traps
hallucinated_features.reason: The backend includes a play() method that unconditionally calls Runtime.trap() with a Game Over message. This was not requested in any requirement and serves no valid purpose in the gameplay architecture.
The backend submitScore function adds both the score and score * 2 to the highScores list. This doubling behavior was not requested and appears to be hallucinated logic.
